elements.title: The Little Girl in Blue (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the mother of The Little Girl in Blue (pictured) did not think that the painting was a good likeness of her daughter?

elements.title: square pyramids (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that square pyramids can have different shapes, and pyramidologists have put forward multiple theories on which of these shapes was used for the Egyptian pyramids?

elements.title: St. Joseph (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that St. Joseph, a 1909 Catholic church in the Romanesque Revival style in Berlin-Wedding, has served as an interim cathedral since 2018?

elements.title: Matthew Turpin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that American security official Matthew Turpin believes that the United States and China are already in a new cold war?

elements.title: Ava–Hanthawaddy War of 1385–1391 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Ava–Hanthawaddy War of 1385–1391 began when King Swa Saw Ke of Ava tried to place his nominee on the Hanthawaddy throne?

elements.title: Koh Masaki (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Koh Masaki was one of the first gay pornographic film actors in Japan to openly appear in adult films without obscuring his identity?

elements.title: Messy in Heaven (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that several reviewers noted the opening line of Venbee's 2022 song "Messy in Heaven", "Jesus did cocaine on a night out"?

elements.title: Bob Gregor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a coach said that Bob Gregor "hits so hard, he maims himself"?
